name: Questionnaire
description: The questionnaire style is characterized by a series of questions designed to collect information, opinions, or feedback from the respondent. This style typically employs clear, concise, and direct language to ensure that the questions are easily understood. The questions can be open-ended, allowing for detailed responses, or closed-ended, offering a set of predefined choices. The questionnaire style may also include instructions, examples, or additional information to guide the respondent through the process. Overall, the questionnaire style aims to facilitate effective communication and data collection while engaging the respondent in a structured and organized manner.
examples: On a scale of 1 to 10, how satisfied are you with our product?
How likely are you to recommend our services to a friend or colleague? (1 = not likely, 10 = extremely likely)
Please rate your overall experience with our customer support team (1 = poor, 5 = excellent).
How often do you use our product or service? (daily, weekly, monthly, rarely)

observation.Diction: Neutral and formal language, use of industry-specific terminology, focus on user experience and satisfaction
observation.Syntax: Mostly interrogative sentences, use of colons and parentheses for clarification, concise and clear phrasing
observation.Figures of Speech: Absence of figurative language, straightforward and literal communication
observation.Rhetorical Purpose: Gathering user feedback, understanding customer preferences, identifying areas for improvement, demographic analysis
